content.description: Yet another moderate at slide wall. Brand new - expect lichen until it cleans up.
content.location: Furthest left at the wall, starts just left of Memento Vitae.

content.description: A thin start leads to fun climbing on large holds. The direct start feels a bit harder for some  (two moves of maybe 9 or 10- right off the deck) but can be easily bypassed by traversing into the first bolt via jugs to the right of the bolt line.
content.location: This route is located 10 feet to the right of the bolted line Integral.

content.description: Another fun moderate. Brand new so be prepared for dirt and potential loose rocks.
content.location: Starts about 15-20 feet to the left of Go Back to the Bay, past some bushes. It is the right of the two routes at the far wall.

content.description:
"Remember you must die" (Latin translation). This route presents far more of a mental challenge than the easier climbs to it's left, and is more akin to Drowning Machine (it's neighbor to the right). While being technically quite moderate at 5.10a, this route feels more committing and heady. Recommended for confident 5.10- leaders.

I'm giving this a PG-13 rating based on the rather precariously stacked pile of massive blocks which marks the beginning of the route. I extensively jumped around on said rock pile, they seem fine, but they are spooky. I recommend you take a nice long look at this stack before saying, "yea, this is a good idea". It's not the worst idea to have your belayer stand back a ways while you climb to the first bolt, just in case.

First bolt is about 20 feet high after climbing low 5th class rock stacks. Follow 5 more bolts with some committing moves through varied terrain to mussy hook anchors.
content.location: Located on the same buttress as Drowning Machine, about 10-15 feet to it's left. Starts the obvious pile of stacked blocks. First bolt is about 20 feet high.

content.description: Climbs an enjoyable series of jugs linked by a discontinuous crack. Surprisingly good holds and surprisingly good gear. Interesting dikes and horizontal placements make this a unique climb for the area. Worth the trip to Slide wall. If you didn't being trad gear you can easily top rope this after climbing Integral (shared anchor). If you're in the neighborhood, this fun moderate is not to be missed.
content.protection: Single rack to 2", Mussy Hook Anchor
content.location:
From Drowning Machine, walk left along the base of slide wall for about 50 feet. Iris is the discontinuous crack located a few feet to the right of Integral. This climb is located directly underneath the shared anchor with Integral.

Note: This wall is home to some of the only poison oak I've seen at the emeralds, watch yourself.

content.description: Jug City! Follow 6 bolts of jugs up a vertical wall to meet at the anchor of Iris. Great holds and unique dike formations. Fun! From the anchor don't miss top-roping Iris if you didn't bring trad gear.
content.location: About 55 feet left of Drowning Machine, the currently left most bolted line at Slide wall. See Iris for beta photo.

content.description: Originally a trad line, now bolted because no one brings gear to the Emeralds. Fun, easy climbing.
content.location: Goes up the obvious gully/dihedral left of Integral and right of Go back to the Bay.

content.description: Before anyone gets their panty's in a bunch, the name of this route is geared toward all the city folk trashing our watershed this summer (2020). I'm not hating on all you bay area climbers. For the most part my interactions with bay area climbers are pleasant, polite, and downright enjoyable. I like you guys, stay gold.
content.location: Located just past the dihedral that is Gutter Ball. just past the gully. Starts on a fun finger crack on the slab, first bolt is after 15 feet of easy climbing. Climb though a finger crack, hand crack, great edges, and a steep slab finish.

content.description: Starts in the obvious fracture between Iris and Name of the Wind.  Follow the weakness up to the large left facing flake. Move left and up using holds on the main wall until you can step back over right to the top of the flake. Beware some loose rocks here and move carefully as the flake seems well attached on the right side but it is unclear if the left is also that way. Continue to follow the fracture straight up until it joins the crack at the top of Name. Resist clipping the bolts here as the short finger and hand crack takes beautiful cams and jams. Same hook anchor as Name.  Good gear and lots of stances.
content.protection: Good nut placements, .3 to #2 Camalot (consider doubles of some if you dont mind the weight). Can also get a #3 in down low
content.location: The fracture 3 feet climber's left of Name of the Wind

content.description:
This wall and its anchor were originally top roped by Mike Carville and Josh Horniak many years ago and bolted with their permission.

Start on the bottom right of the Slide Wall. Get right into some fairly challenging moves through the first 3 bolts on the face with small crimps (

staying out of the dirty corner

). Reach a ledge and step left to pull the bulge. The next 4 bolts prove to be fairly consistently difficult all the way to the top.

Note: The climb is still a little licheny but per the usual the more traffic the better.
content.location: Bottom right of the Slide Wall. To the right of the giant blocks.
